summary: Email correspondence between attorney Brad Edwards and federal prosecutors regarding the drafting of a protective order for the disclosure of the non-prosecution agreement to Jane Does 1 and 2. The discussion centers on the terms and implementation of the order, with Edwards proposing modifications to expedite the process.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Plaintiffs' attorney negotiating the terms of a protective order with federal prosecutors regarding the disclosure of the non-prosecution agreement to his clients.

persons.name: Paul Cassell
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding the draft protective order.

connections.description: Edwards is the attorney representing the interests of Jane Does 1 and 2, as he discusses his duty to instruct them on the protective order.

events.title: Judge's Order on Protective Order
events.description: A judge issued an order the previous day regarding the establishment of a protective order for the non-prosecution agreement.

keyFacts: A protective order is being drafted to govern the disclosure of a non-prosecution agreement to attorney Brad Edwards and his clients, Jane Does 1 and 2.
Brad Edwards objects to a proposed paragraph that would require his clients to formally acknowledge receipt and agree to the order's terms, arguing it causes unnecessary delay.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal negotiations between plaintiffs' counsel and federal prosecutors in the Epstein case regarding evidence disclosure.
